text: Theodore "Ted" Ku-DiPietro (born January 28, 2002) is an American soccer player who currently plays as a midfielder for Loudoun United in the USL Championship. == Career == Ku-DiPietro was a standout player at Oakton High School in his hometown of Oakton, Virginia, being named first-team all-state as a sophomore in 2018. Ku-DiPietro played his first professional game on June 28, 2019, winning 2–1 against Atlanta United 2. Ku-DiPietro scored his first- ever professional goal in his first season with Loudoun United, on September 25, 2019, in the 68th minute of the team's 4-1 win over the Swope Park Rangers. https://www.uslchampionship.com/loudoununitedfc- swopeparkrangers-1037492 Ku-DiPietro also received his first-ever red card in the same match. Ku-DiPietro signed his first professional contract with Loudoun on January 7, 2020. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|Cup !colspan="2"|Continental !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- |Loudoun United |2019 |USL Championship |9||1||0||0||colspan="2"|–||0||0||9||1 |- ! colspan="3" |Career total !9!!1!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!9!!1 |} ;Notes ==References== Category:2002 births Category:Living people Category:American soccer players Category:Association football midfielders Category:D.C.
